title: Dion Waiters becomes Miami Heat's first NBA Player of the Week in a year
text:
Dion Waiters becomes Miami Heat's first NBA Player of the Week in a year Erik Spoelstra on the long view with Dion Waiters 
Erik Spoelstra says the Heat, Waiters are open to more than just this season. 
Erik Spoelstra says the Heat, Waiters are open to more than just this season. Ira Winderman since the breakup of the Big Three, but Dion Waiters now has his moment, named Monday as NBA Eastern Conference Player of the Week for the period ending Sunday.
Waiters becomes the Heat first Player of the Week since Dwyane Wade was named Jan. 31 last season, and just the 12th in the franchise's 29 seasons to be so honored. Heat players have now taken the honor a total of 54 times. 
Waiters had not previously won the weekly honor over his first five NBA seasons with the Cleveland Cavaliers and Oklahoma City Thunder . 
Included in Waiters' performance over the judging period was a game-winning 3-pointer against the Warriors and then a decisive late 3-pointer two nights later in Brooklyn. Over the course of the four-game judging period, Waiters averaged 23.3 points (tied for eighth in the East), 5.0 assists and 4.5 rebounds, connecting on 12 of 25 3-point attempts. 
Since LeBron James left as a free agent in the 2014 offseason, the Heat have not had an NBA Player of the Month and only four times have had a Player of the Week, with Chris Bosh named on Nov. 2, 2014, Wade on March 22, 2015 and then last season, and now Waiters. Teams nominate players for the designation, with the Heat pushing both Waiters and Goran Dragic , with the Heat going 4-0 over the judging period, with victories over the Golden State Warriors, Brooklyn Nets , Chicago Bulls and Detroit Pistons .

Sacramento Kings center DeMarcus Cousins was named Western Conference Player of the Week. 
Among those also nominated for the Western Conference honor were Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry, Memphis Grizzlies center Marc Gasol , Phoenix Suns guard Eric Bledsoe and Portland Trail Blazers guards Damian Lillard and CJ McCollum . 
The Heat last week were shut out of the All-Star selection process for the first time since 2004. 
Waiters was signed as a free agent in July to a two-year contract that includes a $3 million player option for next season. 
The 11 previous Heat players to be named NBA Player of the Week were Rony Seikaly, Glen Rice , Chris Gatling, Tim Hardaway , Alonzo Mourning, Eddie Jones , Wade, Lamar Odom , Shaquille O'Neal , Bosh and James.
